medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 11 weeks prior to admission with a pustule on the right hand following a fire-ant sting, accompanied by rigors and fever (38.9°C) developing four hours later. A pruritic rash appeared the next day, spreading over the following days. Six weeks before admission, the patient noticed slightly enlarged, nontender lymph nodes. Approximately 11 days prior to admission, a rash with low-grade fever and drenching night sweats developed, followed by severe fevers (up to 40.0°C). Four days before admission, the patient had a diffuse erythematous rash and multiple swollen lymph nodes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, gastroesophageal reflux disease, rosacea, and recurrent herpes simplex virus infection.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had lung cancer; maternal grandfather died of pancreatic cancer; father died of Parkinson’s disease.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with husband, mother, and a pet dog; worked in a professional occupation; consumes two to three alcoholic beverages per week; does not smoke or use illicit drugs; has no known allergies.
